website_summaries.verdict: These rugged hiking boots keep you comfortable and protected on even the rockiest trails, and they won’t break the bank either.
pros: Uppers are made of full-grain leather
Tongue is fully gusseted to keep out dirt and debris
Boots have light cushioning and shock absorption thanks to compression-molded EVA midsoles and footbeds
cons: Some buyers find that the boots scuff easily
They don’t offer much traction on snow and ice

customer_reviews.title: SOLE CAME APART LESS THAN 1 MONTH
customer_reviews.text: Have the same boots from years ago and they held up to this day. Purchased new pair from here on October 24th and right boot is falling apart already. Horrible quality and its clear these were outsourced to be manufactured else where. Extremely disappointed to spend hard earned money on this junk! Want refund!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Fake boots
customer_reviews.text: From what I found out these boots are fake They don’t register with timberland The emblems are incorrect and does not have the key features to original timberland boots I’ve been wearing timberlands for 25 years and even I didn’t realize at first but yet I did have suspicion
customer_reviews.author: Stewart S.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof. Unless they get wet. The first time I wore them in the rain my socks got soaked.
customer_reviews.author: George Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I got these hiking boots for an upcoming trip and decided to go for a 2 1/2 hour hike through a local nature preserve to break them in. I was surprised by the instant comfort and the very little need for breaking in. I'm wear a 10.5 and I ordered a 10.5 and the fit is spot on. For the price I wasn't expecting the boot to be as comfortable and well built as it is. I would be happy recommending this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Dickers

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, a great fit, and a rugged leather outer.
customer_reviews.text: Delivery took a couple weeks. Light weight, a great fit, and a rugged leather outer. I'm quite happy with this shoe. I was looking for a hiker that was supportive, with good winter traction, and waterproof for slogging through the winter snow and slush. I also wanted it to look sporty enough to go with jeans or pocket pants. This shoe does all that. You will need to oil the leather to keep the appearance up as you would any wet weather shoe. A great purchase, I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Fillmore2

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes about a month ago, & have been wearing them to work ever since. It fits great, is really comfortable, while at the same time maintaining a good look. I highly recommended it. Note: it does get a bit slippery on water, so be careful with that. But I love the fact that it's water proof. I give kids showers while using them. It gets soaked on the outside, but never seeps in. Overall it a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: The Reviews Dude

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF NOT WATERPROOF NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: I work at a full service car wash. I need something waterproof but light. I don't need rubber iron Man boots. After my White Ledge boots were only kind of waterproof, these are absolutely NOT AT ALL WATER PROOF. Very first day wearing these within an hour, water soaked not just the inside of the shoe but the entire outsole and I'm in Michigan so it FREEZES. What are these fake Timberlands????? Spent a lot of hard earned money on FAKE BOOTS idk where these 5 star reviews are coming from.....
customer_reviews.author: Dylan L.

customer_reviews.title: Get These!
customer_reviews.text: My husband works in landscaping, and he wears these everyday. Everyday! They are waterproof, for sure. He works in wet and dry weather and he loves them. The tread is still kicking strong and he has had no problems with the quick-lace prongs. The shoe has been strongly holding on to the sole, unlike in some of the reviews I read before deciding on these. All in all they are a great workbook for a great price. His fit as expected. Oh, and just a note on where he wears these boots, Middle Georgia, so lots of muck & dust.
customer_reviews.author: Britt akins

customer_reviews.title: Third pair of timberlands.
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots. They fit pretty well, but seem just a touch wide. I wear a medium weight sock with them, so if you wear thicker socks, they'll probably be about perfect. Plenty of room in the toe box, which I do like. This is my third pair of Timberland boots and second time buying the Flume boot. As far as durability, I would say they are fair, but didn't take a great deal of wear and tear. On my previous two pair, the soles separated from the shoe with light to medium duty use. Still they look good and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MrMr

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from Timberland
customer_reviews.text: They started out excellent, fit well and I could hardly feel myself wearing them. Waterproof, skidproof etc. etc. It hasn't even been a year and the heel loop broke, without me pulling hard. My heel started to hurt after wearing these for long periods as well. The laces are TERRIBLE, they just love coming loose. Can't recommend these to anyone, there have to be better pairs of snowboots out there. Even the $35 bestseller snowboots I got from Amazon lasted longer than these (3 years and counting), I just don't like the look of those. That I will say for these boots, they do look pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchit Batra

customer_reviews.title: These are really good
customer_reviews.text: If you notice I bought 2 pairs of your boots, because I have two different size feet. It's a problem. It's always been a problem. Just try finding two pairs of shoes in WIDE sizes for two different sized feet that look the same. It's the hunt for the golden goose. I been chasing that goose for 30 years and it's a fast goose. This is my second pair of Double sized Timberlands and this pair fits better than the first........Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made to hold up as expected
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these boots a few months the fronts of the boots started to come apart from the material and water would come in (and I don't mean from stepping in large puddles either) Called company, didn't even want them replaced they stated that I would have to send them back and if it did't meet there criteria nothing would be done and I would have to pay return shipping. Also I did take pictures of boots and info on tongue so they could clearly see the problem. I Would not buy timberland again and would not recommend buying there products.
customer_reviews.author: Frank T

customer_reviews.title: Not the Timberland quality I knew
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these boots was not what I expected from Timberland. I ended up returning them. I purchased these as more of an everyday boot to wear instead of sneakers when the weather was raining and somewhat on the cold side. The leather seemed so thin, that I felt if I had worn them once, even for casual dress, that they’d look a year old afterwards. Other than that the boot seems OK for being made in China. The fit was about a 1/2 size larger than I expected. Overall I was very disappointed with Timberland the moment I opened the box.
customer_reviews.author: DeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof. Needs more cushioning, an insert.
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. Waterproof and good support for daily use. Very good traction for hiking. Could use more cushioning for hiking up/down mountains. Hiked all day, over rocks, through wet areas & deep mud. Feet stayed dry, good ankle support but the bottoms of my feet were in pain. By the end of the hike it felt like the soles were cardboard due to the pain.
customer_reviews.author: D. K.

customer_reviews.title: Six months in & I like these boots
customer_reviews.text: Held up well, soles are wearing ok, uppers are good, original laces, sole+upper joint have not separated & are watertight. These boots are worn as casual footwear, around the house, hiking, yardwork, cutting firewood, working on the car, hunting the 'back 40', etc. Very comfortable. They still look good and do not look beat up at all even though I don't worry about what happens to them in the mud & rocks. I initially thought I should have bought a half size larger, but kept them anyway and I really like the fit. Perhaps just a smidge short in the toe, but it really could go either way. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: very poor craftmanship in the inner lining of this boot
customer_reviews.text: first pair lasted 2 years before the inside heal tore. they are comfortable so i bought another pair. didnt even make it through half of a winter before the same thing happened. truely disappointed as i always used timberland boots and the craftmanship has just declined over the past few years.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Glue is not holding up, not very water proof in 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these Timberland Men's Flum Waterproof Boots, and in less than one month the side of the sole that meets the shoe is peeling away. It is no longer waterproof and I am very disappointed. I expected that they would last. The glue is not holding up to regular use. I am not recommending them and warn you if you are looking for waterproof shoes keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: roddy heriberto de oleo abreu

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had military boots that felt more comfortabl
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap pieces of junk not recommend it for the workingman I’ve had military boots that felt more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sizing is questionable
customer_reviews.text: My Boyfriend has a similar pair of these in size 10.5. These same boots were at a local sporting good store. He tried on a size 10.5 and they were an exact fit. We ordered 10.5 yet they are too small. When compared to the current Timberland boots he already has it was clear they are about .5 smaller. So we had to go through the process of return and reorder. To worsen the experience the second pair ordered .5 larger cost about 8.00 more. This really stinks AMAZON!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this pair.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple pair of these boots in the past. I normally like them but this last pair has something wrong with the right foot tow area. Feels like there is something under my little tow area. I think that the insert or the boot bottom has a small defect. I took the insert pad out and checked it and the boot itself but can't find what it is. I thought that it just needed to break in a little bit in the beginning but unfortunately it hasn't got any better and now I'm stuck with them. Should have exchanged them in the beginning. My mistake!
customer_reviews.author: christopher c. benchek

customer_reviews.title: Although they can be pricey they’re a good boot
customer_reviews.text: If you work in a wet environment these are the shoes for you. They are comfortable almost from the minute you put them on. They say they are water proof and I believe it as I worked with a Hydrotest machine it tends to splash water around when loading and unloading. These boot are pretty skip resistant as well. They would make a nice hiking boot too. I always seemed to wear out the tread before the top fell apart and I have had several pairs over the past 14 years
customer_reviews.author: maximus181

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, waterproof, and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of boots that were versatile for hiking as well as working on our property that has a lot of hidden uneven rocky surfaces. These boots are very lightweight, waterproof, and best of all keep my feet cool. My feet get hot easily and these boots really do keep them cool. They are durable too. Used these mostly on sharp lava rocks and they are holding up quite well. They do discolor with use but I just apply mink oil and they are as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I received these is late January.  The soles are already worn out.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the comfort but for the price, they didn't last long. I don't wear these every day but the bottom of one shoe has already broken through to the inside. This is unacceptable. I just bought these in late January. I'm so disappointed. You'd think spending this amount of money on boots that they would last more then 3 months. I would return then but now can't see how. If anyone knows how to return other than through Amazon, please share. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: A good value and boot
customer_reviews.text: Seems (only worn one week!) like a good boot.. waterproof as advertised.. I ordered 9W (but have regular shoes 8.5W, that fit perfectly) because of heavy socks in Winter. Very happy with fit.. no tightness anywhere and comfortable. Very light weight too, a plus for me. Would have liked a "softer" heel cushioning for walking comfort, but these are not bad... just not as soft as I prefer. This being my only reason for 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for yard work, a bit stiff for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for working in the yard, and they are very good for that use. They are a bit stiff for hiking, but maybe after you break them in, they would be better. I normally wear size 12-4E (extra wide) but since these don't come in an extra wide, I got 13-2E and that seems to fit pretty well. I added an insert with arch support and extra cushioning, and that seemed to help with the stiffness.
customer_reviews.author: Alan RC

customer_reviews.title: Seems something changed, not at all what I remember
customer_reviews.text: This would have been my second pair of these. The first pair I purchased several years ago and what I remember they were a comfortable boot, even for everyday. I do recall that the soles wore out from 6 day a week construction work faster than some, but they were still comfortable. This last pair that I bought gave me blisters on my achilles within an hour on both feet. I had to stop and change back to my old wore out Danners, couldn't take it any more. Had it not been for that I would have kept them. But not willing to go through that for breaking in a pair of boots!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Drone Speed is an awesome company to work with!
customer_reviews.text: Drone Speed is an awesome merchant to deal with, love this boot, I’ve ordered three of them so far over the last year and a half, I will continue to work with Drone Speed for many years to come. I had one slight mixup on an order and they responded very quickly and rectified the issue immediately. Awesome company! I plan on buying many more pairs of boots from them for myself and my family in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Zabby

customer_reviews.title: Decent Boot
customer_reviews.text: The boots are stylish and functional. I was disappointed that the one boot arrived quite scuffed. I think someone else must have had them and returned them. But, I figured they would get scuffed soon enough anyway. Wore them on a hike on a hot summer day. They were light weight and not too hot. I did cross through a streambed that was mostly dry, stepped in some water, and the boots repelled the water without any issue. The back of the boot is a bit lower cut than expected, but they still gave nice ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots, but narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new set of boots for hiking in the northwest. Mostly day or overnight, not heavy backpacking and these boots are well made with a good solid feel to them, but not too heavy. From a fit perspective, they fit as expected on length, but they are narrow. I ordered the wide option because I like an open toe box, but even at wide they felt snug (and my feet are a little wide, but I mostly wear "normal" width shoes without a problem. Ended up returning them, but would work for some just not me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: multiple pair and each one was deffective
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my husband. had to return them because the sole of the shoe was splitting from the boot. Went through 2 more pair doing an exchange and both had the same issue. Had to pick a different brand and boot.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Binkley

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots!! Fit and finish is great. Light weight. Great looking. Nice sole. I sprayed additional water proofing on them. I like the dark brown, almost black look. I ordered 2 pair. 11 regular and 11 wide. The 11 wide came first. New heavy socks. Fit just right!! Just a little room so your feet and toes aren't cramped. Lost the 11 regular in shipping somewhere. Never got. Glad the 11 wide got through. Will buy again! Great boot!!
customer_reviews.author: LAKESIDE DOUG

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm and true water proof!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots, I work maintenance at a apartment complex in Colorado. I’m always outside and shoveling snow. My feet have never been cold or wet. I work 10 hours days and they are comfortable all day. I have a wide pair due to my duck feet lol! I did not have to break them in. They felt good from day one. I’m a size 12 and ordered a 12. No issues. I’ve had them for about 4 months now. Will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: chuckandshasta

customer_reviews.title: Well made and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these work shoes for my wife since we could not find them locally. They fit her well, are comfortable to wear for long periods of time and she uses them almost every day to work in her vegetable and flower gardens when the weather permits. They are now nearly two years old and still look good. They have held up to a lot of use and she highly recommends them.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: :::Goodbye Red Wing; Hello Timberland
customer_reviews.text: Timberland made me a lifetime customer, because of the quality of these boots. I am a big guy, and am amazed at how long wearing the sole and insole is. The tongue and boot are nicely lined, and thickly padded. The leather is of a nice grade, and I can wear these in NC/SC summers. The insole is 1/8" shorter than a Red Wing of a comparable size; good width, and boots do stretch over time. Red Wing makes a fine boot, but the outsoles just don't wear well to justify their cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: My Grand View
customer_reviews.text: I have always been huge fan of the pros. Only issue I have and it’s not really an issue is the lace hooks. They are shorter boots and the lace hoops are lower and you absolutely have to use to completely tie the boot. Where average height boots you can at times avoid the hooks. Also it would be cool if they would have added some streak or make the emblem /label a silver or off color to make it pop a bit more. Overall. Satisfied
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey franklin

customer_reviews.title: Happy to be back in Timberlands!
customer_reviews.text: Timberland boots have always served me well during years in various brutally cold, wet and snowy winter climates. These fit just like I expected: very comfortable, warm, and waterproof which is essential for me. If you have high snowdrifts,the tops may be a bit short. First heavy snow since purchasing them and trudging through drifts some snow went down inside, but interestingly, the interior seems to wick the moisture away from my feet which is fantastic. And compared to my last (non-Timberland) boots which squeaked on every hard floor in existence, these are silent. It's the little things I appreciate like not slowly going insane from squeaky soles everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my work boots of another major brand, and decided to keep them just to wear around town.. so I can't yet attest to the durability but they are definitely comfortable. I used to wear Timberland boots exclusively, but seemed like the craftsmanship went downhill... So I started wearing other brands. But I would definitely give these a fair chance!
customer_reviews.author: GrayDizzle

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: Why the 3 star review? sadly mine came badly scuffed, and what looks to be superglue (or something?) dripped all over the front of one of them and it wont come off. Due to all that, cosmetically they do not look so great but they would look awesome without all that. However they fit and feel awesome! I love the fit and how comfortable they are! that alone earns a good rating from me. if they would have came new like they was suppose to, i would have happily rated them 5 stars. If you want some boots that fit great and feel even better, grab these!
customer_reviews.author: scotty

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend has been dying for a new pair of Timbs cause his are a good 15 years old. I surprised him for Christmas with these. He is normally a 13 wide but I was nervous if I bought the exact size it would be snug on him. He has big feet. I sized up to the 14 and they fit very well. I probably could have gone with the 13 wide but these fit just as well!
customer_reviews.author: Alana D

customer_reviews.title: Fit great, feel great, no breaking in.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Europe, i needed something that wasn't going to have a long break-in period. They work great, kept my feet from the elements. But they DO NOT breathe at all. Wearing these longer than a few hours left swampy feet in cold or warm weather. The back of the heel becomes abrasive if worn for too long without a break-in. Otherwise very satisfied and they held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Gdp

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced & Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I spent $30 more for these than my long-time stand by high tec boots, and that was money wasted. These have very a thin leather upper that gets scuffed up just by giving them a dirty look. I've only worn them a couple times, with no real "use", no hiking trails, etc., and they're all scratched up. The laces are thin and cheap too. These boots are disappointing. I would not recommend them for the 99 bucks I paid.
customer_reviews.author: SylverBullit

customer_reviews.title: Timberland quality & comfort
customer_reviews.text: Typical Timberland quality, fit and comfort. These are great boots and deliver the same high standards as my other Timberlands. These boots have a subtle yet distinguished style - looks great in black. They are great for work/ office wear and also for walking/ hiking. These Timberlands have the practicality/ purpose of a boot, yet feel as comfortable as your favorite sneakers. As for durability, I have only had these for a short time, however, I have 2 other pairs of different Timberland styles - both of which are holding up just fine after several years and I expect these will last a long time as well. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JohnG

customer_reviews.title: Good set of work boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great, I always replace the insoles with Superfeet or equivalents so the fit is always better. They are waterproof, been over lower laces and feet stayed dry, I will buy another pair as the soles wear out. I am a field supervisor so in and out of truck and office, dry or muddy, sunny or stormy, hot or cold.
customer_reviews.author: Wynn44

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable, almost as comfortable as my $200 Merrells
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10-11 normally (standard width, Nike11, Merrel 10.5, Ariat 11) and these fit perfectly. I was concerned that since these were so inexpensive, they might be "cheap", but they are well made and are of quality leather. Extremely comfortable, almost as comfortable as my $200 Merrells. I wear these for 10-12 hours a day on concrete floors, 6 days a week, and do not hurt at the end of the day. Hopefully they last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Big wide feet. 14Ws fit very well and comfortably out of the box, no break-in needed. Boots were perfectly comfortable from day one. Got 7 months of excellent wear, near daily, extensive hiking. Still wearing them, but the tread/sole is wearing through now, while awaiting delivery of Timberland White Ledges; Flumes in my size currently unavailable. For the price-point these are great boots, would be even better if the soles were more wear-resistant, but for less than $80, 7+ months of heavy wear, not bad. Hoping the similar- looking White Ledges deliver similarly (and for a few bucks less, even).
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: defect
customer_reviews.text: i sent these as a gift for my son in another state when he put them on and pulled the shoes strings the eyelet popped out, he glued it back in for it would be a lot of trouble for him to return them. they fit good and are comfortable but not put together very well. i hope this will be the only problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits well.  Looks sharp.  Stays warm. Stays Dry
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of tims from about 10 years ago that had held up pretty well until now, so I stuck with them. So far so good. They are super comfortable, though I always go a half size up on Timberland. Not much more to say. They do everything they say they will and cause no discomfort whatsoever. You know how you might have to "unlace" a pair of taller boots or high top sneaks to get your foot in? The top two spots get laced through boot hooks and are not permanently fed through grommets or eylets so you can easily pull the tongue way out for putting them on if it is a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit width-wise
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 10.5R so ordered a size 11 R initially thinking that I wanted extra room for thicker socks but the boot was way too narrow even though the length fit fine with regular socks. I returned it for a size 11W which I received promptly, it was a little bit better but it is also a tight fit width-wise. I plan to keep this pair and just see if they will loosen up over the course of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Leather has peeled away from the rubber sole in multiple places on both boots. At the toe on both and on the outside of one boot and on the inside of the other. Won't buy these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Thielke

customer_reviews.title: Great work boots
customer_reviews.text: I work on hills and rough terrain and these boots are great. They were comfortable from the start and are not only used for work but hiking. I’ve had them two months and was in them at least 4 to 8 hours a day every day. They are comfortable and have great support. They are durable and so far have had zero issues in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Allthatisis

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Using for around a week. So far this has been an excellent boot. Was comfortable on day one and did not need any break in period. I walk outside for work 4-8 miles per day. Very comfortable. Dry in rain and snow. Keeps feet warm while working in snow. Fit same as my sneaker size. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Best wearing boot on the market for the money and then some!
customer_reviews.text: I have higher arches not super high but pretty high and plantar fasciitis and these boots are a god send for my feet been wearing them for long time had several pair work standing on concrete running back and forth everyday and I don't think I can find a better more comfortable boot, I used spend 250.00 a pair on ecco's that where no where near as comfortable now I'm under a 100.00 for one of the best wearing boots I have ever purchased and they last good too! Hope they never stop making this boot or I'm in trouble lol!
customer_reviews.author: M.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good boot available in wider widths.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pair and usually wear them out after a year, they are comfortable and can be worn most of the day, for the price they are exceptional. I usually change out the bottom liner and install a better arch support for my high arches but overall it is a good shoe and wears well. I have a wide foot and appreciate they are available on Amazon and can be delivered in a couple of days instead of hunting around all over town to find a wide shoe that usually has to be ordered. Great service Amazon, a winning combination !
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W75

customer_reviews.title: Walking In Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband, who works out doors and does plenty of walking. He loves the boots, say they are really comfortable, flexible, and durable. In fact, He wears them EVERYDAY SINGLE DAY (LOL). He even tries to wear them to church! But I ask him to take them off and wear dress shoes with his suit. it's evident that he loves these boots. I would purchase again, and again. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Dearvon Holley

customer_reviews.title: Quality  product
customer_reviews.text: Timberland makes great stuff. These seems almost identical to the same boots I bought 10? years ago. Those eventually failed because I was using in wet conditions and the sole separated from the upper part. I am trusting that the company has started using better glue.
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Keppelman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boot to walk a pit bull who walks 5-7 miles almost every day. Nothing but the most extreme weather stops her 2 to 3 walks every day. That is why I need a waterproof boot. The boot is comfortable especially for a leather boot which has not been broken in. So far the boot seems to have good waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: SSG Cedar

customer_reviews.title: Best all around boot for me.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, durabilty, waterfrood quality. I treat these with SnoProof every month in winter to keep them waterproof an looking good. Good support and true to fit. I wear a 9.5US and that was perfect. I had been getting cheaper boots from Columbia, and these are 500% better for fit, comfort and performance
customer_reviews.author: Crankmeister

customer_reviews.title: Great fit but boot has a defect.
customer_reviews.text: Boots fit great but there is a defect in one boot on the seam of the boot and sole there is a slight crack. Would like to exchange but they are currently out of my size and I can't find where to contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: My husband is rough on shoes period. These boots however, seem to hold up better than anything in recent purchase. This is his second pair. I gave 5 stars for being truly waterproof, very durable and comfort. Keep in mind, on my husbands foot it ran narrow and fortunately they do make a wider version. It's the only time he's worn a wide shoe/boot.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking to replace a worn-out pair of Vasque hiking boots a number of years ago, I looked at multiple brands and one of the reviews for these Timberline boots caught my eye. A wife was talking about how her husband had trouble finding truly comfortable boots that didn't require a break-in period and how he loved these Flume boots. I decided to give them a try and couldn't be more pleased with their comfort and durability. I'm on my 3rd pair now and would recommend them without qualification.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Clark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, affordable boots.
customer_reviews.text: I wear 12EEEE with crazy high arches and I'm on my feet all day every day, inside and outside, rain, snow or shine. I'm a big guy and tend to destroy uppers well before the tread wear out, usually by having the uppers pull free of the sole or come apart at seams. This is the 3rd pair of these boots I've owned...the last two pair are still physically intact, just no traction left. The boots are plenty warm in winter, cool enough in summer, adequately waterproof and exceptionally supportive. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant R. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Poorest Quality / Not Like pair purchased at Timberland Outlet
customer_reviews.text: This product did not fit properly AND seemed to be made of lower quality materials than the current pair I own. Returned them immediately. Went and purchased new ones at local outlet. (PS: These were made in Phillipines; the pairs I have from the outlet were made in Vietnam and China. Not sure if that is the issue.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 15 year old sons school trip to Hawaii island as they were going on various volcanic hikes on Mauna Kea daily where the terrain was at times slippery/slick from the rain. He said it worked really well and didnt hurt his feet at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani

customer_reviews.title: Water resident and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My grandson is a dog groomer and his feet are always getting wet but not in these boots
customer_reviews.author: gail shaw

customer_reviews.title: Need to be made in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: I have wore Timberland boots for over 10 years. They are always comfortable right out of the box. This time there was a lump like thing putting pressure on the outside of my left foot. This did ho away after I inserted my orthopedic insoles. I would give them 5 stars if they were made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Timberland Quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed to put in a different insole for more comfort. Fit as expected - true to size. Good gripping soles. Quality boot. I prefer GoRuck boots for hiking because they are lightweight and waterproof with lots of other benefits, but I use these as daily wear / light work boots. I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Good experience with Timberland
customer_reviews.text: I have small feet for a man. There. I said it. So, finding anything less than size 8 or 9 is usually difficult at a shoe store. I can wear a size 8, but really need to wear two pairs of socks if I do. Thank goodness for online ordering, I was able to find men's size 7 1/2. I've always had a good fit and short to no break-in time with Timberlands. This time was no different. Good work boot or hiker, happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Always a great boot
customer_reviews.text: I wear these 8-10 hrs a day, waterproof and lightweight. I’ve owned 5-6 pair over the years
customer_reviews.author: Ron Diefenthaler

customer_reviews.title: great fit - not so warm
customer_reviews.text: Boots fit great! comfortable. love the way it laces. Does not chew up the laces like previous versions. However, I would have thought the boots would keep my feet warm throughout the day. Being outside for about 4 hours, my feet were not able to stay warm. Need more insulation Timberland to truly be a quality boot.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Day

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots and wear them for work everyday. You can wear them right out of the box and they will not hurt your feet. I usually buy the Timberland White Ledge Boots but decided to try these because the others where not in stock in my size. The two are very similar and equally comfortable and the only difference I can see is the White Ledges are a little lighter but both are incredibly light for a boot. My wife gets upset with me sometimes because I'm always wearing them (they are the most comfortable shoes I own)
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Barinas

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort with some construction issues.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the fit and comfort on these boots, I do have some issues though. First, the top most outside lace hooks on both boots are pulling out and I doubt they will last much longer and this is only after two months of use. Second, the sole on these boots are wearing faster than expected. These boots were perfect for the first month of every day use but have started to deteriorate. I would not recommend these for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Beringer

customer_reviews.title: My New Dog Walking Boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots on-sale for fifty-eight bucks and free shipping. I needed to replace my old Wolverine dog-walking boots cause they developed a split in the sole and water penetrated inside the boot. I received these Timberland boots just as we got a whole lot of wet/slushy weather here in PA. I have to say these boots have performed very well for my use in dog walking (3+ times day). They are not insulated so I don't think they'd be warm if worn for long periods of super cold weather. I find them very comfortable but only have worn them for short periods of time. I found the sizing to be fairly accurate (maybe a tiny bit under-sized).
customer_reviews.author: Hammer Head

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time ordering these. These are my hubby’s favorite work boots! I order him a pair every year now! He does a lot of walking, the rubber sole is very comfortable! He is out in the elements and his feet never gets wet, we love them! Happy spouse, happy wife!
customer_reviews.author: Box

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best ever
customer_reviews.text: These are a once a year boot purchase for me, i beat the hell out of them and they take it!! all water stays out, my feet have never ever been cold or hot. They are just good boots that look good and perform even better
customer_reviews.author: jayson sulser

customer_reviews.title: Run a full size larger and a half size wider.  No arch support.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look great and appear to be well made. They are unusally light weight. I returned them because they run a full size too large and because there is absolutely no arch support, they hurt my feet the moment i tried th em on. The ad is darker than most shoe images. I couldn't see that they are sold with cheap flat strings that at best will last a month due to the four top hooks. I rated them 3 because you can add good strings and arch supports for about $25.00
customer_reviews.author: w walker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, lighter than expected and good price.
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was bit skeptical to buy these shoes online. I always believed that we have to check for a perfect fit and then make a purchase. I normally use 8.5 W for my dress and sneaker shoes. I bought 8.5 regular and they perfectly fit. Moreover these shoes are so light, it’s like wearing walking sneakers. The price was unbeatable. Loved the color. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great work boot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who wears a men's size 13. They fit him perfectly and he is loving them, especially out in our garden and yard. They are an awesome work boot for any guy and look nice enough to wear out and about town with jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses these for work and this is the second pair he has ordered which shows how good they are. He delivers packages and puts miles of walking each day on these. They fit well and are durable. They are also a good value!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Kay

customer_reviews.title: Toe part came undone after 2 months of wear.
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these for four months now I can say that there very comfortable. Only problem I have with them is the toe part where the rubber comes up to meet the leather. After about two months it started to come undone. So now when it rains my feet get wet. There goes the waterproof function. One would think if you spent a little more than a 100 bucks it would last longer than 2 months. I'll buy a different pair next time.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great boot! There is absolutely no way someone could wear these out in a month unless you're walking in foot deep water or solvent 24/7; or wear the soles out in a month! Where are you one star commentors buying your boot!? This is one of the best boots I've ever owned. My only complaint is that it takes a while for the heel to wear in. They're a bit stiff for a while so I'd give them a 4.5 but there is NO WAY the come close to a 1 star!
customer_reviews.author: RedRocker1963

customer_reviews.title: Man-made material
customer_reviews.text: The show material is man-made and does not have longevity. For box was very good and no blisters when working on roofs or hillsides. If too grain leather would then purchase again, not impressed about the man-made msterial
customer_reviews.author: GoodWhiskey

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are The Bomb. Best pair of boots I have ever owned. They look even better in person than the photos show, inspection shows solid construction and quality materials in every way, and they are very comfortable from the first wearing and stay that way throughout the day. No break-in period was needed other than getting them out of the box and putting them on. I had always heard Timberland made good boots and now I know that's no lie. I could not be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but not a pro grade hiker.
customer_reviews.text: I have been through two pairs of Timbs prior to buying again. The soles are not as good of quality as years ago. Then again they are still good quality leather and style. They fit good and were comfy from the get go. Good quality causal hiker.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: I just bought my third pair.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my third pair. I've hiked to the bottom of the Grand Canyon (twice) and the top of Mt Kilimanjaro wearing these. If I could beg the manufacturer...please don't stop making them! They are a great value. (Note: I always change out the sole inserts. But I do that with every pair of shoes I buy these days.)
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around
customer_reviews.text: These have been excellent. As a goal, my family hikes 100 miles per year. I have 200+ miles on these and they have a long way to go. Waterproofing is great. They are remarkably light. I love the big toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pohlmeier

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable with no break in time
customer_reviews.text: I got these boots because I broke my little toe. I ordered the wide width to give it more room. . They worked great. Wide enough for my injury and still provides support. I grab them for everything now , not just hiking
customer_reviews.author: Julia S

customer_reviews.title: very good boot, supercomodas
customer_reviews.text: Everything described is correct, very good boot, supercomodas, I have always had a lot of faith to the shoes timberland, I had a pair long ago and I lasted 8 years, giving him paw, foot, very good boots these I bought , I will put them to the test in ascents by the mountain more 34km by water, snow, mud, stones, I know that would work very well well for my experience in timberland, if you are looking for a hiking boot this is ideal for you.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the snow
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son for the winter. We didn't get much snow but they are still good for the cold weather. Not too heavy where he can run around in them and they keep him from sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Tinka

customer_reviews.title: Lots of improvements over the years
customer_reviews.text: These are nice. I haven't owned a pair of hiking boots since 1975, since then I've done everything in combat boots. I've now gone back to hiking boots for casual wear and hiking. I love these, so many improvements over the years. Thesent are a perfect fit with cotton tube socks, if I wanted the wear heavier socks I couldn't. They'd be too small.
customer_reviews.author: Bovineguy

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Whole the boots are very comfortable and good for the price, they aren't the exact color as depicted. The boots in the picture look more like a black charcoal rather than a solid black color. I have been crazy hesitant to buy shoes or sneakers on line cause of size insanity with ao many different cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Colon

customer_reviews.title: Fit my problem feet
customer_reviews.text: Have a hard time finding comfortable boots as I'm a heavy man with sensitive feet. Tried 3 different pair and returned. This pair was the only one that didn't have a seam or metal piece that did not rub against bone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but beware durability
customer_reviews.text: Boots are very comfortable and I can walk in them all day long with no issues. However I was very disappointing by the longevity of the soul on the boots. Owned these boots less then a year and the back soul of the boots was already completely worn down and starting getting holes in them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Only boots to buy
customer_reviews.text: Boots fit good and their so much lighter than what my husband is used to. My husband said these were the only boot he was ever going to buy. So they must be good.
customer_reviews.author: Jan B

customer_reviews.title: Good ankle support
customer_reviews.text: My husband has back and knee issues. He wears them to work where the concrete floors are very hard for him to tolerate. They have made a big difference in giving added support and decreased pain. They work well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Willett

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for about a month now. Well made shoe, light and waterproof but little ankle support because laces don’t close off the top properly. This also results in dirt getting inside the shoe and I have to be taking them off to shake out small pebbles that get inside,annoying. Disappointing from a timberland product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Smith

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I need arch support, these shoe will put your podiatrist out of work. With in days they had formed well to my feet. I walk at least 5.25 miles a day. At least once a week I try to double my distance. Lots of stairs as well. My podiatrist said I have pes caves to the 3rd degree.(really high arches) These shoes are sufficient to alleviate that condition at least for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amy F. Mckenna

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough. I removed insole liner from one ...
customer_reviews.text: Not wide enough. I removed insole liner from one of the boots, put it on floor and then put my foot on it and measured the excesses: my foot is 5/8" shorter, while about 1/2" wider than the liner. The liner is 3 & 7/8" at its widest, and 12 & 5/16" long. I guess this method is most accurate to determine the size relations.
customer_reviews.author: Marek P

customer_reviews.title: Good boots for working outside
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair. I work outside in some pretty harsh conditions and the 1st pair lasted close to 2 years. Hopefully these will be the same. I do a lot of walking and climbing in them. They're comfortable and seem to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: Though the boots are light weight. That is nice. The arch is a bit high. But, I am still trying to work them in. But, My feet hurt. I know...Poor baby. Right. I will toughen up.
customer_reviews.author: Woodland_Burl

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots very much. Good fit, they feel like I have slippers on. I will buy again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Alexander

product_meta.title: Timberland Men's Flume Waterproof Boot
product_meta.description: Uppers made with premium 100% full-grain waterproof leather for durability. Waterproof, seam-sealed construction keeps feet dry. Fully gusseted tongue keeps out debris. Compression-molded EVA midsole and footbeds provide lightweight cushioning and shock absorption Solid rubber outsole with multidirectional lugs for traction. Weight of a single boot (size 9): 1 pound, 1 ounce. Imported.
feature_bullets: Timberland Flume men's hiking boots grip rocky trails and crave elevation. Mid-height waterproof hikers keep you comfy and protected, from trailhead to summit and during every adventure in-between.

LOOK NO FURTHER for trail-ready performance and style. Our selection of men’s hiking boots, waterproof hiking boots, casual boots, and casual shoes is designed to fit in with your outdoor-ready ensembles.
TIMBERLAND HAS YOU COVERED whether you're looking for men's boots, women's boots, or kids boots. For the best in hiking boots, rain boots, work boots, casual shoes & boots & more, choose Timberland.
WHAT YOU NEED IN THE OUTDOORS: Timberland has the gear you need for all your outdoor adventures, including jackets and coats for outdoor activities, backpacks and luggage & outdoor accessories.

THE BEST IN OUTDOORS: Trust Timberland's line of high-quality men's, women's, and kids boots. hiking boots, outdoor gear, and activewear for all your activities from the trail to the sea to the streets.
